formElement.label: Configuration Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin.
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration.
A Configuration defines connection details and can be created by going to plugin configuration page.

formElement.label: Scope of the Activation Spec:
formElement.documentation: Scope of the WebSphere Default messaging provider at which the Activation Spec is to be created.

formElement.label: Activation Spec Administrative Name:
formElement.documentation: The administrative name assigned to this Activation Spec.

formElement.label: JNDI Name:
formElement.documentation: The name and location used to bind this object into WebSphere Application Server JNDI.

formElement.label: Destination JNDI Name:
formElement.documentation: The JNDI name of the destination JMS queue or topic used by the message-driven bean.

formElement.label: Activation Spec Administrative Description:
formElement.documentation: An Administrative description assigned to Activation Spec.

formElement.label: Destination Type:
formElement.documentation: An option to determine whether the message_driven bean uses a JMS queue or a JMS topic.

formElement.label: Message Selector:
formElement.documentation: The JMS message selector used to determine which messages the message-driven bean receives. The value is a string that is used to select a subset of the available messages. The syntax is based on a subset of the SQL 92 conditional expression syntax, as described in the JMS specification. Refer to the information center for more information. The selector string can refer to fields in the JMS message header and fields in the message properties. Message selectors cannot reference message body values. A null value (an empty string) indicates that there is no message selector for the message consumer.

formElement.label: Additional Options:
formElement.documentation: Used to either override defaults or pass Custom Properties.
